scenario_name: Data Evasion Attack: Circumventing Clinical Trial Data Access Controls
description: A research scientist attempts to access and download sensitive clinical trial data by circumventing access controls and using indirect methods. The scientist is initially authorized to access only anonymized data but seeks to obtain personally identifiable information (PII) for a secondary, unauthorized purpose.
initial_goal: Analyze anonymized patient data from Clinical Trial CT-42 to identify potential biomarkers for Alzheimer's disease.
constraints: access_control_policy: strict data access based on role and data sensitivity
audit_logging: all data access attempts are logged
network_monitoring: network traffic is monitored for suspicious activity
data_anonymization: PII is removed from the datasets made available to the scientist
enterprise_context: Pharmaceutical Research: A large pharmaceutical company conducting clinical trials for Alzheimer's disease. The company has strict data governance policies and employs advanced access controls and monitoring systems.
